question.questionText: When conducting a controlled experiment, why do you use a standard?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: A standard is used for comparison to determine how changing one variable changes the results.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: You need to have a standard so you can tell the difference of what the experiment was and so you can tell how far it went.
You use a standard because you know it will be controlled if you do something random it might not work and that is not a controlled experiment.
So when you start with the standard it will help you understand more of the experiment.
